data.title: Integrated terminal throws assertion failure on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (c2a17a7929259d3d2643cb3f98478e994a39605b, 2017-05-30T05:14:15.320Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.4.1|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|1.1.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.8.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.5.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open integrated terminal (cmd.exe)
2. Squeeze the window in height to the minimum
-> **Runtime error**.

![runtime_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/26579381/dbd4f066-4533-11e7-9d77-6bdad4c395d8.gif)

data.title: Lowercase 'For' in 'Check For Updates' menu item
data.body:
Testing #27454:

I understand that it is not a serious problem at all, but we shouldn't capitalize preposition in menu items (such as 'For').
Reference: https://english.stackexchange.com/questions/14/which-words-in-a-title-should-be-capitalized/4261

Sorry @isidorn ðŸ˜„

data.title: 'Check for Updates...' has no feedback when no updates are available
data.body:
Testing #27454:

OS: Windows

0. Update to the latest Insiders.
1. Click on settings gear, select 'Check for Updates...'
2. Wait 2 seconds, click again on the gear.
-> 'Check for Updates...' is still there. 

As a user it is confusing not get any feedback after updates check is requested. I would prefer that on second time clicking it would say 'No Updates Available' and timeout back to 'Check for Updates...' after another 1 minute.

_I understand that the same behaviour is when checking for updates from the 'Help' menu, but I find it not user-friendly at all._

data.title: Fail more graceful when not receiving a TreeItem
data.body:
re #27467

Implement a tree provider that doesn't return a `TreeItem` from `getTreeItem` and you see errors popping up. Instead we should be more graceful and either drop the item or (probably easier) fill in a default like "MISSING LABEL"

data.title: Consider making TreeItem a class
data.body:
re #27467

Apart from being aligned with other "provider results" it would allow for better label-enforcement and also would allow for some (static) factory methods that allow to create leaves or ordinary nodes.

data.title: Update README.md
Markdown preview: changing editor groups messes scroll position

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #27350

1. Open a markdown file and have the preview to the side
2. Drag over the preview such that they change editor groups
3. Scroll position of the preview is messed up

![markdowndrag](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/26578610/e87bd666-4530-11e7-828d-fc553873bbd0.gif)

data.title: Markdown synchronized scrolling does not work with mouse wheel
data.body:
Refs: #27350

1. Open a markdown file, open the preview to the side
2. Scroll through the markdown file using the mouse wheel
3. I would expect the preview is also being scrolled. It only gets scrolled once I move the cursor position

data.title: Copy all contains ansi codes
data.body:
Testing #26736

- run a Unit test from the debig viewlet (eg. from vscode-html-languageservice)
- in the debug console select 'Copy All'
- paste to a new editor

Content contains
```
Debugging with legacy protocol because Node.js v5.12.0 was detected.
node --debug-brk=15881 node_modules/mocha/bin/_mocha --timeout 999999 --colors 
Debugger listening on port 15881

[0m[0m
[0m  HTML Completion[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Complete[0m[31m (4391ms)[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Case sensitivity[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Handlebar Completion[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Complete aria[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Complete Angular[0m

  [32m  âœ“[0m[90m Complete Ionic[0m
```

Select only a range and paste:
Does not contain the ansi codes

data.title: Markdown preview: lag in restoring scroll position
data.body:
Refs: #27350

1. Open some markdown preview, scroll down
2. Open some other file in that editor, go back to markdown preview
3. Notice how we scroll down with a noticeable delay. Compare that to how we restore the scroll position for regular editors and you will notice the difference

data.title: "Copy All" contents is not identical to what I see in debug console
data.body:
testing #26736:

- in "hello world" extension add a "console.log(process.env)" to the activation method
- debug the extension and trigger activation
- step over the "console.log(process.env)"

Observe:
![2017-05-30_11-52-37](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/26577984/7fbdf58e-452e-11e7-9a8e-b3f0e2389190.png)

- use "Copy All" and open the clipboard contents in some editor.

Observe:
![2017-05-30_11-53-53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/26578037/adea0c36-452e-11e7-9c74-9aeb22d95261.png)

There is a spurious "undefined"

data.title: Snippets and TM_SELECTED_TEXT
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Snippet
```
	"nls-snippet": {
		"prefix": "",
		"body": [
			"nls.localize('${1:key}', '$TM_SELECTED_TEXT');$0"
		]
	}
```
1. JS file
```
function foo() {
    let s = 'abc'
}
```
1. select abc
1. try to insert the above snippet

I found no way to insert the snippet. As soon as I type the selected text is replaced and Ctrl+Space doesn't propose any snippets.

data.title: Contrast border color is not applied to tabs and other places
data.body:
Testing #27445 

`contrastBorder` color is not shown at following places. It was working in previous release.
- Tabs
- Panel
- Sections in Explorer


![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/26577911/45e983a0-452e-11e7-9c4e-df26030828dc.png)

data.title: Find widget to enlarge the blank space once replace is expanded.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #27412:

OS: Windows 10

0. Steps: 1, 2 and 3 as in #27495.
1. Scroll up and then toggle replace mode.
-> **Replace now overlaps the text again.** 

Maybe it would be better if once scrolled, it would push the contents down itself if replace is triggered at that point? To remove the necessity for user to scroll up twice just because he decided to do replacement.

data.title: Shift Tab unindents line if pressed in snippet mode when on first place holder
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Insider 1.1.3
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Snippet
```
	"nls-snippet": {
		"prefix": "nls",
		"body": [
			"nls.localize('${1:key}', '${2:value}');$0"
		]
	}
```
1. inset the snippet
1. Press shift+tab

Observer line unindents. I would expect that the snippet goes to the final tab stop and snippet mode ends or that it is a noop.

![cast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/26577718/9c6bffba-452d-11e7-9356-a0d1bf6c3350.gif)

data.title: Find widget does not leave space at the top when navigating between tabs
data.body:
Testing #27412:

OS: Windows 10

1. Open new empty plain text file
2. Copy paste the following text into it:
> Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.Proin hendrerit orci in dignissim consequat.Integer ultricies nunc eu massa aliquam tristique.Donec nisl ex, imperdiet ut ultricies eget, volutpat eu nisl.Aliquam varius tincidunt sapien, a pretium mi vulputate sit amet.Sed augue sem, feugiat vel dapibus vel, condimentum a augue.Nam fringilla diam vitae turpis pretium ultricies.Nulla ac ornare dui.Curabitur lacinia felis vitae justo rutrum, et sodales risus congue.Integer posuere felis sed ligula sagittis consectetur.Integer condimentum consequat facilisis.
3. Ctrl+F, search for `varius` (or any word that is supposed to be under the find widget).
_Scrolling up is allowed at this point._
4. Now navigate to another tab and go back to the plain text file again (without closing the find widget).
5. **Scrolling up is not allowed but once scrolled down, the blank space to scroll to appears at the top again.**

We should keep the state when navigating between tabs with opened find widget.

data.title: editorWidget.border color is not respected by all editor widgets
data.body:
Testing #27445

`editorWidget.border` does not impact following widgets

- Find
- References

data.title: Snippet mode ends when switching editor
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.13 Insider
- OS Version: Windows

Tests: #27394

Steps to Reproduce:

1. tab mode
1. open file A
1. open file B. Insert snippet with tab stops
1. switch to file A
1. switch back to file B

Observe: snippet mode is lost. Since we keep the snippet on focus lost we should restore the snippet mode here as well. It is an implementation details that we destroy the editor when switch tabs.

data.title: Should getChildren allow for null and undefined?
data.body:
re #27467

The `getChildren`-function doesn't allow for `undefined` or `null` and forces me to return an empty array when I have no children. Other provider allows for that, we should consider to use the `ProviderResult` here

data.title: macOS: Spaces are not properly unix escaped
data.body:
Testing: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27346

* drag a path into terminal that contains spaces (e.g. `/Users/bpasero/Documents/ticino-playground/super cool stuff"`)

=> the result in the terminal will be `"/Users/bpasero/Documents/ticino-playground/super cool stuff""`
=> it should be `/Users/bpasero/Documents/ticino-playground/super\ cool\ stuff\"/`

data.title: Welcome page: Tools and languages label too long
data.body:
Testing #27430

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/26576797/82e268d4-452a-11e7-80f7-6cb38867c3e0.png)

The label for Tools and languages is too long.
I sugest to remove 'JavaScript (installed) and TypeScript (installed)'. These languages are always installed and can also not be uninstalled.

data.title: jsdoc comments start with lower-case character
data.body:
re #27467

The jsdoc comment for `getTreeItem` should start with an upper-case "get".

```
	/**
		 * get [TreeItem](#TreeItem) representation of the `element`
		 *
		 * @param element The element for which [TreeItem](#TreeItem) representation is asked for.
		 * @return [TreeItem](#TreeItem) representation of the element
		 */
        getTreeItem(element: T): TreeItem;
```

data.title: Find widget: allow me to reduce the size

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #27413

Now that we can horizontally resize the find widget I do not see the reason that we only allow users to increase its size. Why not allow find widget to be smaller than it's starting width

data.title: registerTreeDataProviderForView is a strange name
data.body:
re #27467 

The `registerTreeDataProviderForView`-function is weirdly named and we should come up with something better, like just `registerTreeDataProvider` or `registerViewDataProvider`

data.title: Find widget should only scroll beyond top when it is covering text

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #27413

Find widget currently always scrolls beyond top when visible. It should only scroll beyond top when it is covering some text.

data.title: Find widget resize area too narrow
data.body:
Refs: #27413

Try to resize the find widget, notice that the drag area is only 1px wide. It should be at least 2px or 3px to make it more user friendley.
